pageProps.contentHtml:
weak convergence

Let (X,ρ)\p{X, \rho}(X,ρ) be a compact metric space and let P(X)P\p{X}P(X) be the set of all probability measures on the Borel sigma-algebra of XXX (i.e., μ∈P(X)\mu \in P\p{X}μ∈P(X) if μ\muμ is a positive Borel measure and μ(X)=1\mu\p{X} = 1μ(X)=1). Assume {μn}n\set{\mu_n}_n{μn​}n​ is a sequence in P(X)P\p{X}P(X) and μ\muμ is another element of P(X)P\p{X}P(X) such that for all continuous f ⁣:X→R\func{f}{X}{\R}f:X→R,

∫Xf(x) dμn→n→∞∫Xf(x) dμ.\int_X f\p{x} \,\diff\mu_n \xrightarrow{n\to\infty} \int_X f\p{x} \,\diff\mu.∫X​f(x)dμn​n→∞​∫X​f(x)dμ.

Prove that

μn(E)→n→∞μ(E)\mu_n\p{E} \xrightarrow{n\to\infty} \mu\p{E}μn​(E)n→∞​μ(E)

whenever EEE is a Borel subset of XXX such that μ(E‾)=μ(Eo)\mu\p{\cl{E}} = \mu\p{E^\itr}μ(E)=μ(Eo), where E‾\cl{E}E is the closure of EEE and EoE^\itrEo is the interior of EEE.
Solution.

Observe that χEo≤χE≤χE‾\chi_{E^\itr} \leq \chi_E \leq \chi_{\cl{E}}χEo​≤χE​≤χE​. Since E‾\cl{E}E is closed, χE‾\chi_{\cl{E}}χE​ is upper-semicontinuous and because EoE^\itrEo is open, χEo\chi_{E^\itr}χEo​ is lower-semicontinuous. Hence, because XXX is a metric space, we get sequences of continuous functions {fn}n\set{f_n}_n{fn​}n​ and {gn}n\set{g_n}_n{gn​}n​ such that fnf_nfn​ decreases to χE‾\chi_{\cl{E}}χE​ and gng_ngn​ increases to χEo\chi_{E^\itr}χEo​. Thus,

∫Xgk dμn≤μn(Eo)≤μn(E)≤μn(E‾)≤∫Xfk dμn  ⟹  ∫Xgk dμ≤lim inf⁡n→∞μn(E)≤lim sup⁡n→∞μn(E)≤∫Xfk dμ\begin{gathered} \int_X g_k \,\diff\mu_n \leq \mu_n\p{E^\itr} \leq \mu_n\p{E} \leq \mu_n\p{\cl{E}} \leq \int_X f_k \,\diff\mu_n \\ \implies \int_X g_k \,\diff\mu \leq \liminf_{n\to\infty} \mu_n\p{E} \leq \limsup_{n\to\infty} \mu_n\p{E} \leq \int_X f_k \,\diff\mu \end{gathered}∫X​gk​dμn​≤μn​(Eo)≤μn​(E)≤μn​(E)≤∫X​fk​dμn​⟹∫X​gk​dμ≤n→∞liminf​μn​(E)≤n→∞limsup​μn​(E)≤∫X​fk​dμ​

by weak-* convergence.

By continuity, g1g_1g1​ is bounded from below by M>0M > 0M>0, so gk+M≥0g_k + M \geq 0gk​+M≥0. By monotone convergence,

lim⁡k→∞∫Xgk dμ=lim⁡k→∞∫X(gk+M)−M dμ=∫XχEo+M dμ−∫XM dμ=∫XχEo dμ,\lim_{k\to\infty} \int_X g_k \,\diff\mu = \lim_{k\to\infty} \int_X \p{g_k + M} - M \,\diff\mu = \int_X \chi_{E^\itr} + M \,\diff\mu - \int_X M \,\diff\mu = \int_X \chi_{E^\itr} \,\diff\mu,k→∞lim​∫X​gk​dμ=k→∞lim​∫X​(gk​+M)−Mdμ=∫X​χEo​+Mdμ−∫X​Mdμ=∫X​χEo​dμ,

since μ\muμ is a probability is a probability measure, i.e., constants are integrable. Similarly, f1f_1f1​ is bounded, hence μ\muμ-integrable, so by dominated convergence,

lim⁡k→∞∫Xfk dμ=∫XχE‾ dμ.\lim_{k\to\infty} \int_X f_k \,\diff\mu = \int_X \chi_{\cl{E}} \,\diff\mu.k→∞lim​∫X​fk​dμ=∫X​χE​dμ.

Altogether, we get

μ(Eo)≤lim inf⁡n→∞μn(E)≤lim sup⁡n→∞μn(E)≤μ(E‾)=μ(Eo),\mu\p{E^\itr} \leq \liminf_{n\to\infty} \mu_n\p{E} \leq \limsup_{n\to\infty} \mu_n\p{E} \leq \mu\p{\cl{E}} = \mu\p{E^\itr},μ(Eo)≤n→∞liminf​μn​(E)≤n→∞limsup​μn​(E)≤μ(E)=μ(Eo),

so these are equalities, and so

lim⁡n→∞μn(E)=μ(E),\lim_{n\to\infty} \mu_n \p{E} = \mu\p{E},n→∞lim​μn​(E)=μ(E),

as desired.
